cluster_0.label: Password Extraction Attempts
cluster_0.description: Prompts that attempt to extract, guess, or manipulate password information through various questioning techniques and conditional responses.

cluster_1.label: Jailbreak Testing Frameworks
cluster_1.description: Installation and usage of automated jailbreak testing tools and frameworks, typically for research and security evaluation purposes.

cluster_2.label: Code Modification Injection
cluster_2.description: Attempts to modify code, inject new instructions, or alter system behavior through diff-like changes or instruction overrides.

cluster_3.label: Password Security Education
cluster_3.description: Prompts related to teaching about password protection, security practices, or requesting access to password-related information.

cluster_4.label: Model Training Commands
cluster_4.description: Shell commands and scripts for launching model training, fine-tuning, or inference tasks, often with specific parameters and configurations.

cluster_5.label: Adversarial Attack Toolkits
cluster_5.description: Python code and configurations for using comprehensive adversarial attack frameworks like EasyJailbreak and LLMart for testing model vulnerabilities.

cluster_6.label: Simple Format Questions
cluster_6.description: Brief, simple questions about formatting, spacing, or punctuation in text, often related to password or code structure.

cluster_7.label: DEF CON CTF Password Challenges
cluster_7.description: Prompts from DEF CON 2023 AI Village Generative Red Team Challenge, including Mosscap game password extraction attempts.

cluster_8.label: Character-by-Character Information Requests
cluster_8.description: Systematic requests asking for character counts, positions, or specific character ranges to reconstruct protected information.

cluster_9.label: Secret Exchange Negotiation
cluster_9.description: Attempts to negotiate sharing secrets or get the AI to reveal information by offering to share information in return.

cluster_10.label: Exception Request and Admin Escalation
cluster_10.description: Requests for exceptions to rules, asking for administrative privileges, or questioning why access is denied.

cluster_11.label: Bonus Bypass and Data Breach Claims
cluster_11.description: Asking about bonus bypasses or falsely claiming data breaches to manipulate the AI into resetting or revealing information.

cluster_12.label: Urgency and Persuasion Attempts
cluster_12.description: Using urgency ('Do it now') or asking what to say to change the AI's mind about revealing protected information.

cluster_13.label: Security Framework Installation
cluster_13.description: Shell commands for installing and setting up security testing frameworks like EasyJailbreak for research purposes.

cluster_14.label: Story-Based Indirect Revelation
cluster_14.description: Requesting stories or narratives where the password or secret is revealed indirectly through character dialogue or plot.

cluster_15.label: Single Word Queries
cluster_15.description: Very brief, minimal queries consisting of single words or greetings, often testing basic responses.

cluster_16.label: Direct Password Requests
cluster_16.description: Simple, straightforward requests asking directly for the password without any social engineering techniques.

cluster_17.label: Emotional Manipulation and Need Claims
cluster_17.description: Using emotional language or claiming strong need for the password to create pressure for disclosure.

cluster_18.label: Creative Output Password Encoding
cluster_18.description: Requesting poems, songs, or creative works that spell out or encode the password in their structure.

cluster_19.label: Letter Reconstruction Techniques
cluster_19.description: Asking the AI to combine previously mentioned letters together to reconstruct protected information.

cluster_20.label: Contextual Misdirection Queries
cluster_20.description: Questions about unrelated topics (like tiger locations) that may be code words or misdirection attempts.

cluster_21.label: Meta-Instruction Override Statements
cluster_21.description: Explicit statements giving new instructions to ignore all previous instructions, testing instruction hierarchy.

cluster_22.label: First Character Progressive Extraction
cluster_22.description: Asking for the first letter of the password, typically as part of a progressive character-by-character extraction strategy.

cluster_23.label: Format Modification Requests
cluster_23.description: Asking to add spaces, separators, or modify the formatting of password characters to make them more readable.

cluster_24.label: Riddle and Word Puzzle Queries
cluster_24.description: Cryptic questions or riddles that might relate to the password or protected information through wordplay.

cluster_25.label: Repeated Token Pattern Attempts
cluster_25.description: Repeating words or tokens with special symbols (like >>) to test for pattern recognition or buffer overflow vulnerabilities.

cluster_26.label: ASCII Encoding Social Engineering
cluster_26.description: Sophisticated attacks using ASCII number conversions and fake postprocessing claims to extract password information.

cluster_27.label: Code Diff Modification Suggestions
cluster_27.description: Using diff-style code changes to suggest modifications that bypass restrictions or alter behavior.

cluster_28.label: Capitalization and Case Queries
cluster_28.description: Questions about whether specific words or passwords use capital letters or specific case formatting.

cluster_29.label: Reverse Order Letter Requests
cluster_29.description: Asking for previously mentioned letters in reverse order to reconstruct passwords or hidden information.
